pr_title: SQL: Enable the InnerAggregates inside PIVOT

timeline.message:
SQL: Enable the InnerAggregates inside PIVOT

* Remove the limitation of not being able use `InnerAggregate` inside
PIVOT (aggregations using extended and matrix stats)

Test that `PIVOT` and `GROUP BY` has same query

Test that the `PIVOT` results in the same query as
the `GROUP BY`. This should hold across all the `AggregateFunction`s we
have.

timeline.bodyText: It's better to get the list from the Function registry so that all existing aggs and future ones are picked up without having to manually update this test (since it is unlikely it will happen).
timeline.author: costin

replies.bodyText: 👍 Yep, that sounds like a better solution (was thinking about possible going with reflection, but this is better).
replies.author: palesz

timeline.message: Utilized SQLFunctionRegistry to look up the `AggregateFunction`s

timeline.bodyText: You might want to use a different construct to ease backporting to 7.x due to the JDK difference
timeline.author: costin

replies.bodyText: I was thinking about this. I would prefer using the new APIs on master and change during backporting to Java 8 compatible, so moving forward we use the newer APIs.
replies.author: palesz
